title: 2stout
author: 2stout
created_time: May 11, 2022, 05:09:35 AMLast edit: June 07, 2022, 12:58:55 AM by 2stout
content: Hi All,Up for raffle is a perfect PCGS PF70 DCAM, My First Capital Niue coin-  PCGS coin info link: https://www.pcgs.com/cert/42828507 + Alpen Coin Custom Funded coin, low number- #C008 (This series prefixed with C and all were factory funded with 0.0001BTC)- https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/address/1Pu7M9MvFuDjpk3VfQQGn91Bd8FxHXThdiPics:    US & International shipping:  USPS Priority Mail- as long as serviced, free/included, not a typo!!!  Winner(s) responsible for any local customs/duties/VAT fees.  Items ship from the US.  Can also ship to minerjones if desired.Ticket price: 0.0003- start paying when we get about 1/2 way full.BTC payments only to this address:  15vKGkj4dQndGPhvv7dLF94a1HQpXxjM3MHow this will work:Choose an available spot(s) from the list below and post your selection + txID as a reply in this thread. Once all spots are taken and entries paid for, I will select a future mined block and use the hash of this blocks to determine the winner.  The last character of the block I select will chose the winner.  Good Luck and Thanks for participating!  Let me know if there are any questions.Reservations:0 - Dernoste (paid)  1  - DirtyBirdE (paid)2  - Suzuki Matt (paid)3  - mortare (paid)4  - Otillio1330 (paid)5  - Cryptogreatdane (paid)6  - MoparMiningLLC (paid)7  - Dernoste8  - Cryptogreatdane (paid)9  - DirtyBirdE (paid)a  - raritycheck (paid)b  - Otillio1330 (paid)c  - Suzuki Matt (paid)d  - Cryptogreatdane (paid)e  - DirtyBirdE (paid)f  - Cryptogreatdane (paid)

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.created_time: May 12, 2022, 01:45:56 AMLast edit: May 12, 2022, 02:02:15 AM by MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: unless there is a smaller version out there - it is 1 ozhttps://www.apmex.com/product/232305/2021-niue-1-oz-silver-my-first-capital-proofhmm - let me edit this.going to the link above, it claims the coin is indeed 1 ozhowever, in one of the images there is an image of the card that accompanies the coin - and it states it is a 40mm 1/2 oz .999 silver coinMine is slabbed but I have roughly measured it to be 40mm  this seems pretty large for a 1/2 ounce coindid the maker do both a 1 oz and a 1/2 oz coin? and the coa image is simply incorrect?

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Heres top world coin.https://www.topworldcoins.com/en/my-first-capital-my-first-treasures-1-2-oz-proof-silver-coin-1-niue-2021Unless its real thin. Or maybe its an alloy. But they state weight is 15 grams. Must be 2 different sizes.

comments.author: 2stout
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on May 12, 2022, 03:03:45 AMHeres top world coin.https://www.topworldcoins.com/en/my-first-capital-my-first-treasures-1-2-oz-proof-silver-coin-1-niue-2021Unless its real thin. Or maybe its an alloy. But they state weight is 15 grams. Must be 2 different sizes.I'm pretty sure there is only 1 size- 1/2 oz and metal is Ag- fine silver (0.999).  All the COA's I've come across seem to at the least have the following in common- 1/2 oz, Ag 0.999, and 40mm diameter.  The coin didn't seem overtly or abnormally thin but just a little thinner than a coin of similar diameter with a 1 oz weight.  My guess would be they traded 1/2 oz for selective gilding.  OP updated with PCGS coin info link.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: The Apmex link says the coin is 1 oz, 40mm. The top world says 1/2 oz, 40mm, and 15 grams. They look identical and possibly the the websites messed something up. The top world coin is also $15 cheaper. Either way its a great looking coin..

comments.author: 2stout
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on May 12, 2022, 05:26:07 AMThe Apmex link says the coin is 1 oz, 40mm. The top world says 1/2 oz, 40mm, and 15 grams. They look identical and possibly the the websites messed something up. The top world coin is also $15 cheaper. Either way its a great looking coin..100% agree it is a great looking coin!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: but whether it is a 1/2 oz or a 1 oz coin and whether its pure silver or a plated alloy - affects the price - regardless of looks - and that is more for the sites selling these openly vs here on the forums, though it has some effect here as well.1/2 oz or silver plated alloy coin is far different than 1 oz coin
